description: Listens to element or elements enabled state and perform click when available. Use this method to dispose of unexpected banners which might block the user interface. The listener stops when the driver is disposed or after 10min.

examples.description: Every 3000ms, the banners-listener will search for the elementToActOn. If exists, it will be clicked. this will apply for all the elements found by the given locator.
examples.literalExample: banners listener on {#myBannerCloseButton} using {CSS selector} every {3000} ms

name: ElementsListener

properties.argument: The amount of milliseconds interval between each elements search.
properties.elementToActOn: The locator value by which the element will be found.
properties.locator: The locator type by which the element will be found.

summary: Listens to element or elements enabled state and perform click when available.
